attributes.action: Prosecute University students who break the Covid law
attributes.additional_details: Pass emergency legislation allowing the law to prosecute both individual students and colleges for breach of the Covid isolation laws.
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that some students are deliberately visiting infected households in order to catch the virus and to quote “ Get it out of the way” I believe students must be forced to obey the law otherwise be subject to the full force of the law.

rejection.details:
Decisions about whether to investigate alleged breaches of Covid-19 rules is a matter for local police forces, and decisions about whether to prosecute alleged offenders is a matter for the Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you believe someone has breached Covid-19 restrictions you could report this to the police.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to give local authorities powers to fine educational institutions for failing to prevent students from breaching Covid-19 restrictions, if that is something you want to happen.
